senses.sense_definition: A secondary mark or token added to an object, such as a coin or silverware, to provide security or proof of authenticity.

examples.text: The collector identified the rare coin by its unique <w>countermark</w>.
Inspectors stamped a <w>countermark</w> on the metal to verify its purity.

senses.sense_definition: An artificial cavity drilled into a horse's tooth to make the animal appear younger than it is.

examples.text: The dishonest seller created a <w>countermark</w> to hide the horse's true age.
An experienced vet can easily distinguish a natural groove from a fake <w>countermark</w>.

senses.sense_definition: To stamp a secondary mark onto an object to verify its value, ownership, or authenticity.

examples.text: Authorities decided to <w>countermark</w> the foreign currency to allow its local use.
The guild requires members to <w>countermark</w> their silverware before selling it.
